column3: Each year Rose Hills offers a Memorial Day service for a large number of people on the lawn just east of the Skyrose Chapel. This service honors the memory of those who have served their country in times of danger. It is a patriotic event that is much appreciated by the veterans and the families of veterans living or deceased.Skyrose Chapel is a beautiful and inspirational building, very open, high and airy. I like to enter the chapel after the Memorial Day service, sit in a pew and remember my past and the people who were a part of my past. On a clear day the view of Los Angeles is tremendous from this hilltop sanctuary. A huge window array gives a panoramic view towards the west. This is a very nice setting for thinking and giving thanks to God for his blessings to us.
Sad to say,I’ve been to this local for many funerals,with that said it’s still bueatiful.A very dignified place for this typo event,hopefully you won’t have to visit soon!

column2: Chapel located in a beautiful valley
column3: Been here a couple of times. The Chapel is located in a beautiful valley. The views of downtown and valley from the chapel area are great. Downhill return drive is prettier than uphill. Views from "Canyon View" area are OK.

column2: Serene and majestic place for a memorial service
column3: During the past year, we have attended two memorial services at the Skyrose Chapel. Both events were very respectful of the deceased and uplifting for the mourners.
Went to a celebration service and was a beautiful chapel. Very convenient and can accommodate many people.

column2: Special Place To Praise His Name
column3: The Skyrose Chapel is awesome. It is beautiful, and there are big windows to let a lot of light to come it. The feeling is warm and cozy. It is such an am axing place to pray and relax.
This chapel has a geat view of Los Angeles. I was there for a funeral, but I heard that people have gotten married there too.

For several years I have frequented this Chapel in Rose Hills to pay my respects for family members and friends who have passed away. I highly recommend this Chapel to anyone that needs to make arrangements for a loved one. It is very fitting for all denominations and the staff at Rose Hills do an outstanding job in all regards to assist a family during this difficult time.

Nestled in the Hills of Rose Hills Cemetery is the Skyrose Chapel, my understanding of which has amazing acoustics (organ), as of course beautiful 180+ degree views of the lower hills area(s), of the property. Crypts are available to be purchased and, it's only a shame that one must be "buried" here to "enjoy" a long-term visit :-(I own a pair of crypts in the section facing out from the front entrance, and again, such beautiful views for anyone visiting the site whether for an interest in the chapel or vising loved-ones who've passed.If you happen to be visiting the Rose Hills Property, come take a quick look, if for nothing but the peaceful and relaxing views...

column2: BEAUTIFUL WOODEN CHAPEL REMINISCENT OF FRANK LLOYD WRIGHT
column3: Located high on top of the rolling hills of Rose Hills Memorial Cemetery, west of I-605 and south of CA-60, the picturesque wooden chapel is reminiscent of the Frank Lloyd Wright style of architecture. The chapel is closed most of the time except for individual ceremonies, so it is difficult to get inside. We were able to walk around and peek in the windows.

This Chapel has a great personality, warm and comforting for such a difficult time. The Chapel was roomy with large windows and a pristine view of the area, clouds and birds soaring. I t was was very accommodating for our large group of 200. Our service was well managed.

column2: A breathtaking Chapel designed by a remarkable architect
column3: The chapel, tucked into the Rose Hills is a remarkable hand crafted structure.Designed by architect Fay Jones who is noted for his religious architect is well worth a visit. 3888 Workman Mill Road, Rose Hills, Whiter, California.
